109001.description:
5150: Star Army is a rewrite and update of the military and bugs sections of the original 5150.

This game has a strong focus on military skirmishes of up to about a company, with a platoon being more typical. Each figure represents one man, alien or vehicle. There are three basic scenarios- patrol, attack and defend, which are each altered by a system for randomly laying out the board as well as generating opposing forces for solo players. Individual games can combine in a campaign where individual soldiers improve over time and new recruits might become available.
109001.name: 5150: Star Army

109002.name: Machine of Death
boardgameimplementation: Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination
109002.description:
A 50 card deck of death predictions: ways in which people can die.

Rather than being a game in itself, the cards are a game system: they are used to create and play other games, or optionally supplement other existing games. The cards come with rules for games with players being encouraged to create their own.

The cards feature a single word or phrase detailing how a person can die: for instance, OLD AGE or TRAGIC FLAW or FED UP BARISTA. These predictions can be used in party games ala Apples to Apples: one player names a weapon and the rest submit a card from their hand that they feel could have been given to a person killed with that weapon. They can be used in storytelling games, where each player gets a card and the group must construct a series of events in which everyone dies. The rules also include an RPG of sorts, where players must buy items to kill targets with the deaths dealt from the deck.

109003.description:
Spao is a 3-player ball-stacking game that can be played with a Shibumi set. It uses a '4x4 holes board' and balls in 3 colours.

Each player has an allocated colour (white, black and red). Players take turns placing a ball of their colour in a legal position (hole or 2x2 platform). When the pyramid is full the game ends. To get your score multiply the sizes of your groups. Highest score wins.

Variant for 2 players:

Red balls are neutral. Each player takes 10 balls of his colour (white or black) and 5 red balls. On your turn you place one of your balls in a legal position. Same scoring.

Rules for this game are included in the soft cover Shibumi Rule Book
109003.name: Spao

109005.description:
Jagdfieber ("Hunting Fever") is a light-hearted card game in which you need to play your cards cleverly in order to capture precious prey. But beware! Your fellow hunters may be tempted to steal from you, ending the hunt sooner than you might expect. At the end of the day, captured cards score points for you, but hunters who are caught during the closed season and cards that remain in your hand will reduce your score.

Each player starts with a hand of one hunter, two wolves, three rabbits, three carrots and one closed season/carrot. On a turn, each player secretly chooses a card from his hand, then they reveal the cards simultaneously. If someone played a "closed season" card, than all hunters played are placed in the prey pile of those players. If not, hunters each capture a wolf (starting with the "Hunt starts here" card and going clockwise), place that card in their prey pile, then return their hunter to their hand; any hunter that can't capture a wolf is placed under its owner's hunting lodge (a play area in front of each player).

If any wolves remain, they each capture a rabbit (again starting with the "Hunt starts here" card and going clockwise) and are then placed in the "easy prey" section of that player's hunting lodge; if a wolf doesn't catch a rabbit, return it to its owner's hand. Rabbits are handled the same as wolves, but they hunt carrots (and not themselves!), moving to "easy prey" if they eat and returning to their owner's hand otherwise. Cards in a player's "easy prey" section are captured before a similar card played by that same player during the current turn; if a card is not captured while in the "easy prey" section, it's moved to that player's prey pile at the end of the next turn.

If everyone still has at least one card in hand, move the "Hunt starts here" card one space clockwise and play another turn. If at least one player has no cards in hand, each player scores their prey pile, with hunters worth -4 points and all other cards worth 1-4 points. Players then reclaim their cards and play another round. After four complete rounds, the player with the most points wins.
109005.name: Jagdfieber

109006.name: The Conqueror's Collection
109006.description:
From Rear of Box

So many worlds to conquer
Put your plans for world domination into action in these five great strategy games

Explore, Discover and interact with vast worlds from ancient Rome to Civil War America and into the intergalactic future.

Expand, Plot against enemies, build alliances and bring down dynasties as you build your own empires.

Attack, Formulate your battle plan then test your military strategic genius against masterminds of warfare.

Decimate, Crush the enemy with weapons of the past and future, from axe and shield to high-powered laser cannons.

Conquer, Carry out your master plan with ruthless efficiency on your way to becoming one of the greates tactical military leaders of all time.

109007.name: Chimera Basic: An Introduction to the Chimera RPG
109007.description:
from the Introduction:

Welcome to The Chimera Roleplaying Game!

This is Chimera Basic, designed to show the game's simple mechanics and modular guidelines. Chimera is a flexible, rules-lite engine that promotes your creativity over game rules. From fantasy to sci-fi, and everything in between, Chimera provides a easy-to-learn framework for all your roleplaying adventures.

You can use the Basic guidelines to create any number of characters, settings, and campaigns. If you like what you see, check our Web site (www.welshpiper.com) for Chimera supplements that expand on these rules, detail specific settings, and help you run any Chimera campaign with ease!

rpgitemversion: Hardcover version, English edition, First Printing
109008.name: Anima: Beyond Fantasy – Those Who Walked Amongst Us, Volume I
109008.description:
From the back cover

We were wrong.
We, in our arrogance, thought
we were the masters of this world.
But we had only forgotten the truth...
or did not want to see it.
They were here all along.
Fairy Tales. Nightmares.
They were all read.
We exist...for now,
but only until "they" return.
They...
Those who walked amongst us...

Those Who Walked Amongst Us is the definitive book of creatures and monsters from the world of Gaia. Within its pages you will find the most fabulous creatures and stories, and countless unique abilities to customize your character or make your own entities. With it, you will open the door to a new dimension of fun, mystery, and endless challenges in the world of Anima: Beyond Fantasy.

109009.description:
At the starting gate the tension is very high, the snow is perfect, the atmosphere is the one of the big occasion. In an explosion of force, power and technique you face the first run of the giant slalom during the first meeting of the white circus.
You are one of last season's best skiers and lots of fans are expecting a great result from you and you cannot disappoint them. You will count on your incredible talent, your explosive strength, your cold lucidity. As cool calculator you will fight against all the hazards of the track to the best of your abilities.
Win the race and be on the cover of the most famous sporting magazines of the world.

Slalom is a game for 2 to 4 players (the single descents serve only for training). The competition is divided in 2 runs where every skier in turn tries to descend in quickest possible time to complete the slalom. The skier will move on the 14 tiles, using the values of the card they received at the start and at the two intermediate times.
Every move on the race tiles will be followed by a positive or a negative change of the starting time.
The hourglass will force the players to organize the sequence of their plays in the available time, in order not to lose precious hundredths of second.
The cowbell represents the support of the people near the track and it will help the skiers during the critical moments of the race...
109009.name: Slalom

109010.name: Obama / Nobama
109010.description: A trick tacking game centered around US politics. Each card represents a controversial and/or humorous issue being discussed on 24-hour news stations, and tricks represent gathering the most viewers (via making the most controversial statements) at different time slots. Instead of conventional bidding, players select their true party (hidden) and their apparent party (visible). Each party offers different scoring incentives and different special powers, and players sometimes have the option to switch parties.

109011.name: StrikerZ Card Game
109011.description:
StrikerZ Card Game Description:
StrikerZ Card Game is a fantastic football game with cards! It is not a game "about" football. It IS football! Players pick and discard through a full deck as they try to get one of the three combinations to shoot for a goal! Each team has 11 players, 3 super-subs and a manager! Enjoy light and fun strategy as the shooter and keeper try to outsmart each other on shot attempts: Big Goals! Big Saves!
Do you think that you will manage your team to easy victory? Will the referee and assistants influence the game for you or against you? Watch out as there are whistles, offsides, yellow cards and red card ejections! Either manager can make a key substitution at the right time to change the game! A game of skill and luck!
This is an excellent game for football fanatics, couples, or children.

For 2 players, Ages 7 to Adult, 30 minute time frame.

109012.description:
Agricola: De Lage Landen is an expansion for Agricola that is published by the Dutch game company 999 Games. It combines certain decks previously released separately in other languages, as well as some new decks.

The expansion is divided in 3 decks (240 cards in total):
- Netherlands-deck (NL-Deck)
- Flanders-deck (FL-Deck)
- Wallonia-deck (WA-Deck)

Next to this, it also contains:
- Agricola: Through the Seasons
- Stylized grain and vegetables resource pieces (to replace the standard resource discs)
- Sticker sheet
109012.name: Agricola: De Lage Landen

109013.name: Forbidden Lore
109013.description:
subtitle: Rules for Original Dungeons & Dragons Combat Using the Chainmail Rules

from the Introduction:
This pamphlet (formatted to neatly fit into an original D&D boxed set) is designed to hopefully clear some of the cobwebs by compiling the hints throughout the original brown booklets and spelling out the missing information. It presents a unique and potentially quite fun variant on combat in original DUNGEONS & DRAGONS, and one the author hopes will provide enjoyment in actual play as well as one potential answer to this philosophical debate.

Note: to use this pamphlet you will need BOTH the original DUNGEONS & DRAGONS booklets AND the original CHAINMAIL rules. It does not reproduce rules from either source; it merely serves as a bridge to link the two, cross-referencing rules from D&D with those from CHAINMAIL.

user note:
This publication is available as a free download from the author's site.

109014.name: The Age of Conan
109014.description:
from the Introduction:
Welcome, Lords and Ladies, to this, the latest in a long line of recent unofficial supplements to the original Dungeons & Dragons role playing game. What lies herein is not a slew of new rules, options, monsters, character classes, and such (though it does see its fair share of each), but rather notes for translating D&D into the very sword-and-sorcery world that inspired the game in the first place: the Hyborian Age of Robert E. Howard.

user summary:
A fan-made collection of notes on setting an original D&D campaign in Robert E. Howard's literary Hyborian Age. It recommends several other products, some out-of-print, some new, in order to fully develop a campaign.

109015.name: Wheel of Fortune 2
109015.description:
This Wheel game was updated from Sony's 2003 online game. Another version of Wheel of Fortune 2 was released in 2010 and titled as a Platinum Edition, although the graphics are the same as its 2007 counterpart.undefined

Source: Wikipedia, "Wheel of Fortune (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

109016.name: Little England
109016.description:
The Kingdom is united no more! Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland have risen up to invade their historical oppressor! 2-4 players take the role of the four countries as they carve up England for their own glory.
Primarily card-driven, players will play attack cards to cities of different strengths (including bluff cards) to wrestle control of the cities away from their opponents. However if more than two countries turn up for a fight, politics and alliances intervene as players make simple deals with those in the battle.
Every time a city is captured, the final points value of the city drops. After five rounds of play the country with the most control points is the victor.
Little England is a free print and play game requiring only five pages for the game (four double-sided) and one double-sided sheet for the rules.

109017.description:
The challenge: Be the first to build a complete and balanced 5 stage rocket! The problem: Rocket parts roll out of the factory on a random schedule and are often miss routed to other launchpads!

Launchpad 23 is played with Looney Pyramids and IceDice dice on a 3x3 board. The dice determine which piece is added to the center of the board and how many moves the current player has to get desirable pieces on to his launchpad and undesirable pieces off of his launchpad or on to opponents' launchpads.

Also included in Pyramid Arcade.
109017.name: Launchpad 23

109018.name: The Age of Conan:   Secrets of  Acheron
109018.description:
Subtitle: A Black Grimoire for the Hyborian Age of Robert E. Howard

from the Introduction:
Welcome to Age of Conan: Secrets of Acheron. This book is a follow-up to the first Age of Conan "hack" for the original edition of Dungeons & Dragons. It is commonly thought that the Hyborian Age of Robert E. Howard is a "low fantasy" or "low magic" setting. This is patently untrue. Magic is part and parcel of the Hyborian Age, and it is everywhere. It just takes a very different form than that in what might be called "vanilla" or "bog standard" D&D games.

Magic in the Hyborian Age is alien, unnatural, and corrupting. It can be helpful, but is far more often harmful and inimical to human life. It comes from the Outer Dark, the home of the Nameless Old Ones who ruled the world thousands of years ago, before even the sorcerer-kings of Acheron held sway over the Hyborian peoples.

This book, then, is all about magic in the Hyborian Age. In it you will find new spells, new takes and tweaks on the sorcerer class, and information on books of magic and artifacts, and even a few magic items to boot.

user summary:
A sequel to the Age of Conan campaign notebook. This sourcebook/guide adds information on magic for a Hyborian Age campaign using the original D&D rules.

109019.description:
This is a game inspired by the spewing eruptions of volcanoes. The setup leaves an empty space in the center of the board, akin to the caldera of a volcano. Capture the winning pieces by causing eruptions!

Using the same erupt-and-capture mechanism as Volcano, Caldera changes just about everything else. The following play summary requires no prior knowledge of Volcano, but does assume a basic knowledge of Looney Pyramids.

Using 6 rainbow stashes, four of the colors in each stash are set up on a Volcano board in nests. Since there are only 24 nests, the center of the board is left empty. The 5th color of each stash is used for caps (generally black, the opaque color). The players move caps to cause eruptions to capture pieces, but also have the option each turn to execute a Power Play: return a previously captured piece to the board. The game ends when one player has captured 3 monochrome trios--that player wins.
109019.name: Caldera

109020.name: Sam Stoat Safebreaker
109020.description:
User Summary

You are Sam Stoat, a cunning cat-burglar, and you are out to purloin a few upper class homes in the poshest street in town. Sneak into the place, find the dynamite, find the safe, get the goods, retire rapidly and off to case the next joint. It should be a piece of cake if it wasn't for all the nightlife... Vicious gnomes, bats, spiders, bouncing bed springs, all pose a threat to your well-being. And then, there's the case of your escape route... It could get ugly.

109021.name: Guestbook: Taco Girl
109021.description:
From CriticalHits.com and the printed game with permission of the authors.

About Taco Girl

She works at the Taco Hut seven days a week, mostly afternoons because she takes classes at the community university in the morning. She likes history and art and maybe if she’d gone to a better school she could have been a scholar. As it is, she takes your change and your abuse when you order twenty-six 50 cent tacos.

Last week, while cleaning up, she found a dead man in the bathroom. Horrified, she called the police, of course, but not before taking a DVD labeled ‘the secrets of the History’ in shaky handwriting. In blood, the dead man had written ‘work must go on.’

user comment
see the RPG entry for what a Guestbook Character Item contains

109022.name: Samurai Trilogy
109022.description:
User Summary

In Samurai Trilogy you are a martial arts warrior trying to achieve the accolade "War Lord". In order to achieve this you must perfect the Karate, the Kendo and finally the Samurai fight itself while trying not to be cut into a thin sliced loaf at the same time. You must select a strategy to adopt and three types of training to improve. Before each fight you must choose your attack and defence tactics. If you choose wrongly, your opponent could have a big advantage over you.

109023.name: Know Your Bible
109023.description: Card game with trivia questions about the Bible. It also has rules for a Biblical Patience game using the cards.

109024.name: Skate Crazy
109024.description:
User Summary

You are Freddy and your task is to impress your friends, and the judges, in an exciting skateboarding competition consisting of four challenging stages. The car park where the challenges are taking place is full of hazards so you must be careful not to crash or get too tired. There is a time limit involved so you must be speedy. Additionally, if your performance is below par you must repeat the stage.

109025.name: Fiendish Aspects
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
109025.description:
User Summary

The combined Fiendish Aspects I, II and III for Fiendish Codex I: Hordes of the Abyss.

This version is still available on the WotC web site as a pdf download.

109026.name: Footballer of the Year
109026.description:
User Summary

In Footballer of the Year you assume the role of a 17-year old soccer player playing for a fourth division club. One of your goals is to make it to first division. Hence, you must be successful enough in your career, and in the transfer market. You should also score plenty of goals. Getting nominated for footballer of the year and, better yet, winning the award, is your ultimate goal and is sure to do wonders to your reputation.

109027.name: Footballer of the Year 2
109027.description:
User Summary

You control a fledgling soccer player with the ultimate goal of winning the Footballer of the Year award. The only way to do this is by scoring as many goals as you can in a single season. Climbing up the league ladder and making more money is not beyond your scopes either.

109028.name: Iced In
109028.description:
Iced In is a follow up to the widely popular Boxed In & Boxed In 2 games for the iPhone & iPod touch that have been enjoyed by millions of people.

Whether or not you played the original Boxed In games you will enjoy the increasingly difficult puzzles of Iced In.

The object of the game is simple. Free the penguin from its cage in each level. To free the penguin push ice blocks onto each big red switch. All switches must simultaneously have an ice block resting on it to open the cage and pass the level.

Be careful! Once you push a block of ice it doesn't stop until it hits something and cracked pieces of ice can only be touched three times before it breaks completely!

Sound easy? It gets tough! Real tough! Iced In will provide many hours of gameplay.

FEATURES


50 Increasingly Difficult Levels
Auto-Save Functionality
Unique Puzzle Mechanics Not Found Elsewhere
Hours Of Gameplay
Fun Music & Sound effects Complimenting Iced In's Theme.
Designed Specifically for the iPhone & iPod Touch
Quick Level Restart For When You Get Stuck
Simple Intuitive Interface
Easy Controls: Swipe To Move / Optional Directional Pad
Disable Sound/Music To Listen To Your iPod While You Play


Source: The Developer Website.

109029.description:
First the Pigeon wanted to drive a bus. Then the Pigeon found a hot dog. Now the Pigeon wants a match in this new game from University Games. Based on the Pigeon book series by Mo Willems, The Pigeon Wants a Match Game finds players trying to collect the most matches of hilarious images from the books. Color-coded borders and backgrounds make pairing tiles easy and fun for even the youngest matchers. The game is designed to help develop visual literacy and coordination skills. This game brings the fun of the books to kids in a new way.

The difference between The Pigeon Wants a Match and Memory is that The Pigeon Wants a Match has a tile that will allow you to gain an extra turn and one that will force you to lose a turn if you turn over a certain tile.
109029.name: The Pigeon Wants a Match

109030.description:
From the Publisher's website:
Space Ludo is, well, Ludo, a traditional race and capture game enjoyed around the world. Ludo is related to Parcheesi and Sorry. All of them are simplified descendants of the ancient Indian cross and circle game, Chisinau.

Space Ludo offers an addicting blend of luck and strategy. Dice are involved yet crucial choices occur frequently. The rules are simple yet the game is always interesting and pleasant to replay. Such are the hallmarks of a classic and so, Ludo has stood the test of time.

Space Ludo utilizes the standard, widely known Ludo rules. These comprise the foundation of play and will be familiar to long time players. New players are encouraged to play the standard game first.

Space Ludo adds the death match element, wormholes and other optional rules to expand and enhance the game.

Space Ludo is part of the LPG Best Boardgames of All Time series which also includes Cam, Camelot, Fox & Geese (Knights & Champions), Halma, Hex, Nine Men's Morris (Triple Threat), Surakarta and Three Musketeers.

It's also an official "spinoff" based on the universe of the acclaimed Digital Eel computer games, Strange Adventures in Infinite Space (free) and Weird Worlds: Return to Infinite Space (published by Shrapnel Games).
109030.name: Space Ludo

109031.description: Over the Top contains a full year-by-year overview of the 1915-18 period, new Battalion-level army lists for British Empire, French and German forces, and a new army list for the American Expeditionary Force, including the Devil Dogs and US Tank Companies. It also contains detailed rules covering such actions as assaulting a trench line, or leading a hand-picked party on a trench raid, as well as background missions to set miniature wargames within the larger backdrop of some of the greatest actions of the First World War.
109031.name: Over the Top

109032.name: Warriors of Mars
109032.description:
User summary:
Warriors of Mars is a fan-made supplement for OD&D that provides guidelines for adapting the OD&D rules to run a campaign set on the Mars of Edgar Rice Burroughs novels.

This booklet is based, in part, upon the Warriors of Mars miniatures rules by Gary Gygax and Brian Blume, expanding the ideas from that publication for use in OD&D campaigns.

109033.name: Challenge of the Frog Idol
109033.description:
User summary:


This scenario was Dyson Logos' answer to the Fat Frog Challenge presented by JB on his BX Blackrazor blog.


From the Introduction:


The Frog Idol has stood in the Black Mire for ages untold - an idol of an ancient and forgotten god who now only manifests through this ancient rock in a forgotten place. However, with the conquest of the dwarven citadel of Kuln by the giants, adventurers have been seen again in the city of Coruvon. And from Coruvon, the Black Mire is always in sight.


This adventure is designed as a site-based adventure setting for a party of characters of levels 3-6 set in the Black Mire west of the city of Coruvon.

109034.name: Philotomy's Musings
109034.description:
from the Overview:

What This Book Is About

This booklet is about OD&D, as it is played when I run the game. When I talk about "OD&D," I'm referring to Original Dungeons & Dragons (published in 1974), which included three booklets: Men & Magic, Monsters & Treasure, and The Underworld & Wilderness Adventures. There were multiple rules supplements released for OD&D, including Greyhawk, Blackmoor, Eldritch Wizardy, and Gods, Demi-gods, & Heroes. There is also Swords & Spells, a set of miniature rules based on D&D and Chainmail. Lastly, I consider the Holmes Basic Set as a close relation of the OD&D family. My personal OD&D game consists of rules from the three brown books, plus house-rules (i.e. I'm not using many rules from the supplements). It also owes a great deal to Meepo's Holmes Companion, which got me started down the OD&D path. I hope the thoughts on this page will be helpful to someone that is thinking about running an OD&D game. There's also a link to my B4 Lost City campaign log on the web, at: http://www.philotomy.com/lost_city.html

109035.name: Santa's Soldiers (First Edition)
109035.description:
From the back cover:

Saving Christmas...By Any Means Necessary

Join the OSN and save Christmas from the depredations of Santa's deadliest enemies!

In this hilarious roleplaying game, you take the part of an elf operative in the Order of St. Nicholas, Santa's paramilitary defense force! Take on bizarre villains like the Winter Wizard, the Boogieman and Anti-Claus!

109036.name: Outlines
109036.description: One player draws a card and describes the shown image to the other players who are simultaneously drawing what is described. The images are generally geometric shapes. After 1 minute the drawers judge their image against the original and receive 1 point if it matches. First player to 15 points wins.

109037.name: Word Scramble
109037.description:
Word Scramble bills itself as a "phonological awareness and word-building game". Tiles are used to make words in the middle of playing board.

Based on the squares on which their pawns land, players either blindly draw a tile, move a tile already on the board or read all the words on the board. Five board spaces direct the player to draw a tile give them the choice between the word beginning or ending piles. Nineteen spaces specify from which pile the player should draw. Those spaces also direct the player to define the word played, rhyme it, use it in a sentence or use it in a question. Four spaces direct the player to read all the words already on the board, awarding four points for doing so. Landing on one of the four corners allows the player to move a tile already on the board.

Tiles drawn or moved are placed on one of 61 spaces in the middle of the board which have either word beginnings or endings. Harder-to-match tiles or spaces are worth more points than easy ones. Points values range from one to six. Play ends after one player reaches a predetermined number of points.

109038.name: Tracon: Air Traffic Control Simulator
109038.description:
TRACON is a software program that simulates an air traffic control environment on a personal computer. The game lets you play the role of controlling the air traffic at Los Angeles International (LAX) airport. The game play screen only consists of air traffic control radar, indicating incoming air traffic. Besides the radar, synchronized speech also alerts your attention of the incoming traffic. Directing traffic is done so by typing in commands to designated airplanes.

The game familiarizes a player with the difficulty of tracking many events simultaneously. Every aircraft is moving in a dynamic environment. The player must develop a feel for three-dimensional space represented in two dimensions on the screen. Generally, aircraft must be kept separated by 1,000 vertical feet and three miles horizontal separation. A series of alarms sound if adequate space between aircraft is not maintained. A few separation conflicts can quickly wipe out the player's entire accrued point value. The closer aircraft get, the more severe the warnings. A mid-air crash ends the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tracon II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

109040.name: Soccer Star
109040.description:
User Summary

Soccer Star is a soccer management game. You start as the manager of a lower division team and must see to it that your team develops and makes it to higher divisions. Hence, you must increase your players' skills and assign them appropriate positions. Your team's finances are also very important as you have to pay wages and avoid bankruptcy.

109041.name: TRACON II
109041.description:
TRACON II is the follow on a software program simulating an air traffic control environment on a personal computer. The game shipped with three sectors: San Francisco, Boston, and Los Angeles. These are simplified but spatially-accurate models of regions. Wesson sold additional packs of sectors simulating other parts of the US.

In the game, aircraft with a flight plan involving a landing must be vectored to a proper altitude at the start of the approach pattern. For example, if the approach started at 1,700 feet on a heading of 170 degrees, the player needed to get the aircraft near that altitude and heading. At that point, the aircraft is handed off to the approach controller. The aircraft responds, "aa34 switching to tower frequency." This changes the aircraft's icon to flash in a different color. If successful, the icon would change to, "AA34 is landing."

Source: Wikipedia, "Tracon II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

109043.name: Tracon II for Windows
109043.description:
Windows versions of the game were an evolution of the DOS versions of TRACON and TRACON II".

In addition to more sector charts, sound became more seamless than in DOS versions. It was easy to turn on sound without being distracted by the game freezing as each sound played.

Another addition to the program was the existence of VFR general aviation pilots in simulations. In many simulations, a number of VFR icons criss-cross the screen. Occasionally, one would call, "Cherokee five five zulu with you at three thousand five hundred." The player would have to ask the VFR pilot to squawk their transponder, making the VFR craft's icon bloom on the screen. This separated the calling aircraft's icon from other identical VFR icons on the screen. Within a short time frame, the player had to attach the correct ident (55Z) to the VFR aircraft. The squawked icon would only bloom for a few seconds. If too much time passed, the player had to repeat the request and try again. It becomes essential to have the sound working properly if you want to handle this VFR traffic , else it becomes necessary to scroll up/down your dialogue window to see the calls made by any VFR entering so that you may call them with their proper call sign or you can not identify them and consequently control them.

It is worth mentioning that in this TRACON for Windows version the player is given the option to work in TRACON or RAPCON but under RAPCON we simply see a classic Terminal Area Control over some military sectors, without any apparent possibility of reverting to the Precision Approach Radar position.

The Windows version of Tracon can be run directly under Linux by means of the Wine application.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tracon II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

109044.description:
Spline+ was evolved from Spline by adding ball movement. It's a ball-stacking game that can be played with a Shibumi set, as it uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in two colours (white and black). Larger boards can also be used, but no more than 6x6 is recommended.

Rules:

Definition: A pinned ball is a ball that supports 2 or more balls on the level above. Pinned balls cannot be moved/removed. Free balls are balls that are not pinned.

2 players. The board starts empty. Starting with white, players take turns either:

a) placing a ball of their colour on an empty space or platform (2×2 arrangement of marbles) or...

b) moving a free ball of their colour already on the board to another valid location. If supported balls drop as a consequence of the ball removal, you can't place your ball on top of the dropped balls.

Aim:

The first player making a full line of his color on any layer wins. Lines may be diagonal.

This is, for a 4×4 set, a 4-in-a-row on the first layer, or a 3-in-a-row on the 2nd layer, or a 2-in-a-row on the 3rd layer.

In case of several lines being created as a result of balls dropping, the largest line prevails.

ONLINE PLAY

http://www.jocly.com/jocly/hubquick/shibumi-splineplus

(Human and AI)

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf
109044.name: Spline+

109045.name: Taxifahrer
109045.description:
Players represent taxi drivers and have to drive passengers through the city, earning money.

Every player starts with a passenger card, which gives him an address where to pick up a passenger, and a destination, where that passenger wants to go. He then rolls the dice and moves his taxi on the mapboard to the given locations. On grey colored spaces, he has to discard one of his four petrol cans; if he discards the last, it's time to visit the petrol station for refuelling. On his moves, a player has to obey all traffic regulations like road signs, speed limits, pedestrian crossings, and so on. If he violates a rule, any other player may point that out and the offender has to pay him a fine of 20.

After bringing a passenger to his destination, the player gets payed and draws another passenger card.

The taxi driver who first collects the sum of 400 fares wins the game.

109046.name: Acchiappa il Fantasma!
109046.description: Casper the ghost is the star of this game where two teams must to hide their 10 ghosts. Each turn the players will choose an object of the other team hoping to find a ghost. The winner will be the team who will find all the ghosts of the opponent.

109047.description:
A replay game of grand prix motor cycle racing.

Players control all motorcycles in a motor cycle grand prix race. The game includes statistical data for every circuit raced in 1984, and for all classes of motorcycles, like 80, 125, 250, 500c.c. as well as sidecars.

After you have decided which race to run, you set up all the drivers (represented by cardboard figures). For every racer you turn up a card from a deck of race cards and compare the individual driver's rating with a table printed on each card. The card now tells you if the racers stay in the group of motorcycles they are currently in, if they fall back to the previous group, overtake other drivers within their group, or even catch up with the group in front of them. Mechanical troubles as well as possible accidents are also covered by the results of the card.

After a number of draws, depending on the racing course and class of motorcycles chosen, the race is over.

The game lets you replay any single race from the 1984 season or even the whole championship.
109047.name: International Road Racing

109048.description:
An expansion for International Road Racing that uses statistical data to recreate individual races or the whole championship of the Grand Prix motor cycle 1987 season.

The game also includes optional rules for positioning individual racers within a group.
109048.name: International Road Racing 1987 Up-Dates

109049.description: An expansion for International Road Racing that uses statistical data to recreate individual races or the whole championship of the Grand Prix motor cycle 1988 season.
109049.name: International Road Racing 1988 Up-Dates

109050.description:
Ice Racing is an expansion set that lets you recreate the Ice Speedway world championship finals from the years 1983 to 1991.

The expansion consists of a data sheet for each year and a new set of trouble and injury charts representing the different hazards for ice speedway.
109050.name: Ice Racing

109051.name: Kasse-Gasse
109051.description:
Kasse-Gasse is played with a deck of 36 cards and a die. Each card shows a word from which one letter is missing. The die shows six letters: b, d, g, k, p and t (the 'plosives').

At the start of the game, the cards are shuffled, and eight cards are drawn and placed on the table, face-up. Then, the die is rolled. All players now search for a word on one of the cards that can be completed with the letter rolled. The first player that finds such a card and pronounces the word correctly gets to keep the card.

Then, a new card is drawn and the next round starts. At the end of the game, the player who has collected the most cards wins.

109052.name: Chi?
109052.description:
Italian board game of the '70, based on the TV show "Chi?".
Each game consists of 4 rounds: memory test, ability, identikit and crime fiction.

In the first round (memory test), the player who plays the host role (or presenter) shows an image, to each player, for a very short time (10 seconds). Each player, then, must answer to the questions and remember the details.
In the second round, ability, the players, to gain the priority to answer, must to insert quick as possible a colored ball into a "tower" selector.
The "Identikit" is a character hunt.
Last round is the crime fiction. Who is playing the host role selects 3 cards, one for each deck: "chi" (who), "dove" (where) and "che cosa" (what). The players must to use clues to find the solution.

At the end, the player who scores more points is the winner.

109053.name: Ubongo
109053.description:
This board game is a blockbuster in countries as Germany, where its popularity has taken Ubongo to the highest position in the lists of sales of board games. The game has sold 900.000 units in Germany (including all the different versions) and has won many awards, including Best Family Game award in Sweden (Ubongo is the only game that has won this award two times, in 2003 and in 2009) and Game of the Year award in Norway and Finland.

Ubongo is a game that will enjoy the whole family. Its mechanics is very simple; since it consists of being solving puzzles "Tetris-style" with the aim to obtain gems of colours. At the end of the established time, the player who has more gems will be the winner. Under this seemingly simple premise an extremely addictive game hides... You always want to play one more time!

Source: The Publisher Website.

Cover - By Paul Damon

109056.name: Hell on the Margin
109056.description:
Generic Sci-Fi wargame aimed at divisional level forces and playable in an evening.
Figures are mounted on bases that represent platoons and are activated by a command point system resulting in a simple and quick flowing game concentrating on high level tactics rather than individual weapon stats.
Rules and organization tables are included for two human and two alien forces models for which were available from Irregular Miniatures in the UK.

109057.name: Bournville Cocoa
109057.description:
Cadbury placed this game into a children's Christmas annual, called Chick's Own, in 1952, as an advertisement for their hot cocoa drink.
Any number can play. Give each player a piece of paper and get them to write down Cadburys Bournville Cocoa on it.
The idea of the game is to collect all the letters that spell Cadburys Bournville Cocoa. Almost every square on the board has a letter, so if you arrive on a square you can tick off that letter from the name on your paper.
You need a 6 to start (of course!).
If you land on a square with special instructions, you must obey them.
The first player to tick off all their letters, wins. And the rules say you should get a steaming cup of lovely chocolately Bournville Cocoa.

109058.name: The Conflict
109058.description:
The Great War (1914)

It is the summer of 1914. The Archduke Franz Ferdinand (heir to the throne of the Austro-Hungarian Empire) and his wife have just been assassinated in Sarajevo. In retaliation for this offense, Emperor Franz Joseph of Austria-Hungary has declared war on Serbia, an ally of Russia. This sparks a world of controversy and very quickly large military powers such as Germany, The Ottoman Empire, France, and Great Britain join in the fray. Two allegiances emerge, The Central Powers & The Allied Powers, with one goal in mind: WAR!

Do you have the economic aptitude and tactical know how to help your nation survive The Conflict and rescue a world in peril. Are you brave enough to face tanks, planes and other modern warfare in order to lead your alliance to victory? “The Great War” has begun, and ready or not, you better lace up your boots and prepare for battle.

The Conflict is a global-strategy based game designed around the economic and military conditions of Europe in 1914. Players play in one of two alliances, The Central Powers or The Allied Powers, to defeat their opponents. Players choose among seven nations (Austria-Hungary, Germany, Great Britain, France, Italy, Ottoman Empire, and Russia). After selecting a nation, players take turns completing their objectives during each round.

Note: The Conflict requires players to strategize both economically and militaristically in order to win the game.

Note: Military units will vary per nation, based on the technological restraints of the nation and its overall capability for growth.

Planned release date is 2012.

109059.name: The Last Edda
109059.description:
The great World Tree is rotting...

The forces of Asgard and Vanaheim have turned against one another. The minions of Jotunheim and Svartalfheim have gone insane. Diseased, toxic creatures spew forth into Midgard, and the gods, once protectors of that land, have forsaken humankind in their blind rage against one another. Once their sacred protectorate, Midgard is now their battleground.

In The Last Edda, players take on the role of one of six Norse gods and do battle, taking control of the monstrosities pouring out of the tainted Yggdrasil, in order to defeat their rival.

The Last Edda blends the mechanics of player combat and deck building card games. Each turn, a player has the option of directing monsters from a common pool at his opponent, while his opponent has the opportunity to defend the attack by playing unit cards from his hand. The turn also provides an opportunity for players to buy cards from personal and common supplies, and construct buildings and artifacts that remain in play and help you to defend and attack more effectively.

Yggdrasil, the World Tree is rotting. The air grows colder and drier by the day. Murmurs of Fimbulvetr and Ragnarok can be heard across Midgard. Which of the gods is strong enough to survive the coming storm?

109060.name: Race Thru Space
109060.description: A game published by Ovaltine, presumeably a free giveaway to advertise their beverage. It is a simple roll and move game through the solar system.First to finish, wins.

109062.name: PlayStation 2 Memory Card
videogamehwversion: Transparent Blue 8MB Sony PlayStation 2 Memory Card
Transparent Red 8MB Sony PlayStation 2 Memory Card
109062.description:
The standard PlayStation 2 memory card has an 8 MB capacity and uses Sony's MagicGate encryption. This requirement prevented the production of memory cards by third parties who did not purchase a license for the MagicGate encryption. Memory cards without encryption can be used to store PlayStation game saves, but PlayStation games would be unable to read from or write to the card – such a card could only be used as a backup. There are a variety of non-Sony manufactured memory cards available for the PlayStation 2, allowing for a larger memory capacity than the standard 8 MB. However their use is unsupported and compatibility is not guaranteed.

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

109064.description:

Control Room

Mechana Construct

Once per turn, you may put a Mechana Construct you control on top of the center deck. If you do, acquire a Mechana Construct in the center row and put it in your hand.

5 Honor

109065.name: Radikal Bikers
109065.description:
Radikal Bikers is a 1998 arcade game set in a Mediterranean environment by Gaelco based on delivering pizza on a rare italian Scooter Called Italjet Dragster in heavy traffic before your AI opponent does, while getting points. It has multiple difficulty levels, including Capricciosa (medium), Margherita (easy) and Diabola (hard). If you beat all four races in a level, you get to play the next level free. The spiritual successor to this game was Smashing Drive.

Source: Wikipedia, "Radikal Bikers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
